description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the information disclosure vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-26177 affecting the Windows kernel, several security updates are available for different Windows operating systems:

1. Download and apply the relevant update package from the Microsoft Update Catalog based on your Windows version.
   - For Windows 10 version 22H2 for x64-based systems, apply KB5035845.
   - For Windows 11 version 23H2 for x64-based systems, apply KB5035853.
   - Ensure to check additional updates such as KB5035856 for Windows Server 2022 or KB5035858 for Windows 10 based systems.
2. Restart the system after installation to ensure that the updates take effect.

**Details**:
This series of updates addresses sensitive information disclosure issues within the Windows kernel, ensuring that unauthorized access to registry key values is mitigated. For manual installations, visit the respective links to download the updates:
- [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845)
- [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853)
- [KB5035858](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035858)

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system is compatible with the installed Windows version.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
